page.title: 01DARLINGTON, CENTRAL & EAST
page.content: {Darlington}is a town with a population of approximately{98,000. {The western}side of this block is predominently residential but includes a large hospital and public park. The northern part includes one of the largest areas of Darlington,{Albert {Hill,}originally an area of heavy industry, now just supporting small factory units. In the town centre is the beautiful old{parish church of St {Cuthbert,}a market hall and space for an outside market, held on Monday and Saturday. Darlington has 2 railway stations including{North Road, the {historic terminus of the Stockton and {Darlington railway.} There are large residential areas on the eastern side and also the former Paton's and Baldwin's factory, 'the queen of factory buildings' in the late 40's. {G. Garrett
